node.title: DatePicker & TimePicker - Manual keyboard input issue.
node.body:
<!--

-->

## I'm submitting a...
<!--
  Please submit:
  * Feature requests to our UserVoice Portal at https://goo.gl/HsVr7R.
  * Support requests to https://www.telerik.com/account/support-tickets.
-->

<!--  Leave one of the following options. -->
* Suggestion for improvement

## Current behavior
<!--
  * Describe the current (faulty) behavior which is caused by the issue.
  * In the latest package versions, check whether this behavior still represents an issue.
-->
Using the demo from the documentation, once a time is set, it becomes difficult to change the hour or minute via the keyboard (using the keypad).  The arrow keys work flawlessly, but as an example, if we have 10:30 freshly set via the set button (in its drop-down), I can type two keystrokes and it'll keep.  However, once set by the keystrokes, if I return focus on the minute and type two new digits/keystrokes, it only accepts the first digit/keystroke and loses focus.

Allow two digit keystrokes to be accepted and retained before losing focus or advancing to the next option.

node.title: Add support for frozen columns
node.body:
## I'm submitting a...
* Suggestion for improvement

## Current behavior
Frozen columns isn't supported in React.

## Expected behavior
Setting the GridColumn prop locked={ true } should freeze the column so the table scrolls underneath.

## Minimal reproduction of the problem with instructions
This is currently supported in the JQuery version but not the React version.
https://demos.telerik.com/kendo-ui/grid/frozen-columns

## What is the motivation or use case for changing the behavior?
We have a very large grid that can have an unknown amount of columns depending on the data. The user could lose track of what row they are looking at without an identifying column being fixed.

node.title: NumericTextBox currency format is cumbersome to edit
node.body:
## I'm submitting a...
* Suggestion for improvement

## Current behavior
Deleting the existing value to type a new one doesn't behave as expected. It replaces the values with 0 instead of allowing space for new numbers.

## Expected behavior
Pressing backspace or delete in the text box should delete the value. Formatting and validation should be applied on blur instead of on change.

## Minimal reproduction of the problem with instructions
https://stackblitz.com/edit/react-6tetzy

**NumericTextBox:**
1. Try to change the cents from 53 to 10 by pressing backspace. The cents becomes 00, and then it will add 10 to the start of the 00 making it $101.1000 which doesn't make sense.
2. Try to change the entire value to $95 flat by pressing backspace to remove the existing value. The total value becomes $0.00, and 95 will be added to the start making it $950. If you press backspace all the way to the $ sign it replaces the first digit with 9, but this is counter to user expectation for textboxes.

**Standard HTML input:**
1. Try to change the cents from 53 to 10 by pressing backspace. The cents will be cleared and the new value can be entered normally.
2. Try to change the entire value to $95 flat by pressing backspace to remove the existing value. The total value will be cleared and become blank, and the new value can be added normally.

## What is the motivation or use case for changing the behavior?
We have a lot of money type textboxes in our app, which are adjusted and edited frequently. It's also an international app and we really like Kendo UI's globalisation features and would like to use them but the Numeric Text Box is a bit difficult to use on a frequent basis.

Browser:
- Chrome (desktop) version 70.0.3538.77 (Official Build) (64-bit)

System:
- Platform: Windows

node.title: IE11 clicking on Multiselect does not always open dropdown list
node.body:
## I'm submitting a...
* Bug report

## Current behavior
In Internet Explorer 11. Click inside the multiselect. The list drops down. Click the multiselect again. The list closes. Click the multiselect again. The list does not open. You must click towards the middle or right hand side of the component.
Keep clicking the multiselect over and over and you will see the list does not open all the time.

(If you click elsewhere on the screen first, and then back to the multiselect again, it will display the list items correctly. Or if you click the multi select multiple times it will display the list correctly)

A summary is: When clicking on the k-multiselect-wrap while the k-input is already focussed, the dropdown list does not toggle. 

## Expected behavior
When clicking the Multiselect it should open the list. When clicking it again it should close the list. Then when clicking it again it should open the list again.

## Minimal reproduction of the problem with instructions
Step 1. Use Internet Explorer 11.
Step 2 Click the Multi Select. The list drops down.
Step 3. Click the Multi Select again, or Select an Item. The list closes.
Step 4. Click the Multi Select again one time. The list does not open.
NB! You must click towards the middle or right hand side of the component. 
If you click close to the left, or close to any existing tags it will work fine

This is the same as the demo site demo:
https://stackblitz.com/edit/react-uydchp?file=package.json

## What is the motivation or use case for changing the behavior?
Whenever a user selects a Multi Select item, they experience buggy behavior, having to click the multiselect multiple times

## Environment
Same as demo site


Browser:
- IE version 11

System:
- Platform:  Windows

node.title: Grid - filter input loses focus on a grid with applied grouping
node.body:
## I'm submitting a...
* Bug report

## Steps to reproduce
1. Go to https://www.telerik.com/kendo-react-ui/components/grid/grouping/ (or to the fork https://react-zvb7mh.stackblitz.io/).
2. Enter any value into Product Name filter, so all data are filtered out.

## Current behavior
Filter input loses focus. User have to put cursor into the filter input manually to continue filter editing.

## Expected behavior
Focus must be kept.

## Additional
1. Reverse actions (clearing filter, until data starts to appear in the grid) also causes losing focus.
2. Unit Price filter behaves differently - when all data is filtered out, the focus switches to Units in Stock filter:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5493641/48468941-64950f80-e7fe-11e8-8cc2-c764fb3f6084.png)
(here I tried to enter `333333` into Units Price filter).
3. I believe, this is somehow related to additional column(s) when there are some data in the grid and grouping is applied:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5493641/48469046-b76ec700-e7fe-11e8-80bc-22aeebc5e64c.png)
Without data it's absent:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5493641/48469064-cb1a2d80-e7fe-11e8-9c43-3edde4f16c2f.png)

## What is the motivation or use case for changing the behavior?
Filtering on a grid with applied grouping.

## Environment

Chrome (desktop) Version 70.0.3538.102 (Official Build) (64-bit)
Windows 10 Pro 1803

node.title: Using props.children for columnMenu attribute results in Cannot read property 'displayName' of undefined
node.body:
<!--
  Please help us process GitHub issues faster by providing the necessary information in the template format that follows.
  We might not be able to assist with issues which lack important information.
-->

<!--  Leave one of the following options. -->
* Bug report <!-- Please search for a similar issue before you submit a bug report. -->

## Current behavior
When using columnMenu as described [here](https://www.telerik.com/kendo-react-ui/components/grid/columns/column-menu/) for React it works providing the columns are not passed via props.children.

As we want to encapsulate a lot of functionality within the grid, I have a grid component (which has filtering, grouping etc functionality), and from an implementation point of view we use this component and pass in our column names. The grid component will then render these columns using `{props.children}`. However, specifying a columnMenu on the columns results in the error:

```
TypeError: Cannot read property 'displayName' of undefined
(anonymous function)
C:/K3Projects/OrchardWebClient/RO/learning-react/node_modules/@progress/kendo-react-grid/dist/es/Grid.js:371
  368 | }, this.props.group !== undefined, this.props.expandField);
  369 | var children = React.Children.toArray(this.props.children);
  370 | this.initColumns(children.filter(function (child) {
> 371 |   return child && child.type.displayName === 'KendoReactGridColumn';
      | ^  372 | }), resolvedGroupsCount);
  373 | var toolbar = children.filter(function (child) {
  374 |   return child && child.type.displayName === 'KendoReactGridToolbar';
```

## Expected behavior
To display a column menu, as it does if not using `props.children`.

## Minimal reproduction of the problem with instructions
Create a component using the Grid component. Use `{props.children}` between `<Grid>` tags. Have another component create this component, passing in the columns as children. Specify columnMenu to these columns to generate the error.

Like:
`<Grid
                    scrollable={"none"}
                >
                    /** Allows user to pass in own columns */
                    {this.props.children}
                </Grid>`

<!-- Describe the motivation or the concrete use case. -->

Using @progress/kendo-react-grid 2.3.2.

node.title: kendo-react-dropdowns doesn't work with react-create-app + typescript.
node.body:
## I'm submitting a...

* Bug report

## Current behavior

kendo-react-dropdowns does not work with create-react-app when using typescript.

> node_modules/@progress/kendo-react-dropdowns/dist/npm/common/settings.d.ts
>  Type error: Ambient const enums are not allowed when the '--isolatedModules' flag is provided.  TS1209

## Expected behavior

Using `<DropDownList>` should not cause an error.

## Minimal reproduction of the problem with instructions

```
npx create-react-app foo
cd foo
```

Now follow the guide here to enable typescript:

https://facebook.github.io/create-react-app/docs/adding-typescript

Note the comment at the end of the documentation:

> Note: Constant enums and namespaces are not supported.

Now attempt to use kendo-react-dropdowns:

```
npm install @progress/kendo-react-dropdowns
```

...

```
import {DropDownList} from "@progress/kendo-react-dropdowns";
```

Gives:

```
node_modules/@progress/kendo-react-dropdowns/dist/npm/common/settings.d.ts
Type error: Ambient const enums are not allowed when the '--isolatedModules' flag is provided.  TS1209

     98 |  * @hidden
     99 |  */
  > 100 | export declare const enum ActiveDescendant {
        |                           ^
    101 |     'PopupList' = 0,
    102 |     'TagsList' = 1
    103 | }
```

## What is the motivation or use case for changing the behavior?

react-create-app is the standard way of create react applications, and have selected the babel typescript integration as the 'blessed' way of using typescript.

Certainly, the typescript standard supports this feature, but `DropDownList` is a fundamental component; this is a show-stopper for using kendo-react.

## Environment

Package versions:
```

node.title: Expose TimePicker setValue function
node.body:
## I'm submitting a...
<!--  Leave one of the following options. -->
* Suggestion for improvement

## Current behavior
There is no official way to manually update the TimePicker for uncontrolled components.

## Expected behavior
Either one of these options would be wonderful:

TimePicker.setValue(date);
TimePicker.value = date;

## Minimal reproduction of the problem with instructions
https://stackblitz.com/edit/react-zphqrv?file=app/main.js
You can see in the HandleChange function, we're forced to use .setState({ value: value }) directly, which may be bypassing some internal logic we aren't aware of in the TimePicker component.

## What is the motivation or use case for changing the behavior?
We have a form with a lot of TimePicker components in the style of:

Monday: {TimePicker Start Time} {TimePicker End Time}
Tuesday: {TimePicker Start Time} {TimePicker End Time}
...

If the user chooses an invalid time e.g a Start time that is after the End time, we would like to allow the change but update the end time to match the start time for ease of use. This is currently a difficult operation.

Using controlled inputs with value={} causes performance issues as the entire page is re-rendered on keystroke so we would prefer to continue using defaultValue={}.

## Environment
Browser:
- Chrome (desktop) version 70.0.3538.110 (Official Build) (64-bit)

System:
- Node version: v8.9.3 6.4.1
- Platform:  Windows

node.title: Passing array with single ExcelExportColumn as Children results in error
node.body:
At this line:
```jsx
const root = React.Children.count(this.props.children) === 1 && React.Children.only(this.props.children);
```
`count` returns 1, but `children` is array, and `only` throws exception. 

Workaround: map the columns to `columns` prop instead of `children` prop.

sample: https://stackblitz.com/edit/react-2b8ek7-qhbqgb?file=app/main.js

node.title: kendo-draggable - Type error: 'bindTo', which lacks return-type annotation, implicitly has an 'any' return type. (Typescript Typings issue)
node.body:
## I'm submitting a...
* Bug report 

## Current behavior
.../ClientApp/node_modules/@telerik/kendo-draggable/dist/npm/main.d.ts
Type error: 'bindTo', which lacks return-type annotation, implicitly has an 'any' return type.  TS7010

line | code
-- | --
8 | export default class Draggable {
9 |     constructor(options?: DraggableOptions)
10 |     bindTo(element: Element)
error     |     ^
11 |     destroy()
12 | }
13 |

## Easy Fix
I just added ": void" return-type declarations to both bindTo() and destroy() in my local copies and it compiled and ran fine.
```
export default class Draggable {
    constructor(options?: DraggableOptions)
    bindTo(element: Element): void
    destroy(): void
}
```

## Minimal reproduction of the problem with instructions
In a Create-React-App 2.1+ Typescript project just import kendo-react-dialogs in a tsx page. Don't even have to use it.
```
import { Dialog, DialogActionsBar } from '@progress/kendo-react-dialogs';
```

## I'm submitting a...
* Suggestion for improvement

## Current behavior
When clicking a button with the Ripple effect, if the result of the button requires high CPU usage, it will freeze the animation of the Ripple and jump to when it is complete.

## Expected behavior
Ripple effect completes while the DOM is busy.

## Minimal reproduction of the problem with instructions

https://stackblitz.com/edit/react-amde8z

Viewer:
https://react-amde8z.stackblitz.io

## What is the motivation or use case for changing the behavior?
We have a tab based layout for our more complex forms that have too much content for a single page. When switching between tabs the ripple animation freezes with makes the page appear unresponsive.

node.title: Material Floating Labels Appears Incorrectly When Autofilled
node.body:
## I'm submitting a...
* Bug report

## Current behavior
Material floating labels overlaps the text on Chrome in autoComplete forms.

## Expected behavior
Floating label initially renders above the input if it is autoCompleted.

## Minimal reproduction of the problem with instructions
I had trouble getting the Editor to display the "save my password" prompt so I recommend the Viewer.

Editor:
https://stackblitz.com/edit/react-bcowxm

Viewer:
https://react-bcowxm.stackblitz.io

1. Type anything into the username and password.
2. Press submit, remembering to click "save my password" when prompted.
3. Refresh the page, the fields should autofill with the yellow background on page load.
4. Clicking anywhere on the page will make the fields realise they have content and the labels will then go to their correct spot.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12272970/51647705-caa3cd00-1fcd-11e9-83cf-a011f62c4ce4.png)

## What is the motivation or use case for changing the behavior?
We just changed our login page to use Kendo Material design with floating labels, but they don't display correctly on Chrome when returning to the site. They work correctly in Firefox so maybe it's something to do with the way Chrome autofills.

## Environment
Browser:
- Chrome (desktop) Version 71.0.3578.98 (Official Build) (64-bit)

node.title: MultiSelect closes upon selection (autoClose)
node.body:
## I'm submitting a...
* Suggestion for improvement

## Current behavior
When the item is selected in MultiSelect, a list with items closes and you have to open it again to select another one. You do not have the option to disable that behaviour.

## Expected behavior
Have the ability to choose if we want MultiSelect to autoClose or no.

## What is the motivation or use case for changing the behavior?
MultiSelects that close everytime you select an item are generally considered as bad UX. Also, you are supporting autoClose feature in the [jQuery implementation of MultiSelect](https://docs.telerik.com/kendo-ui/api/javascript/ui/multiselect/configuration/autoclose)

node.title: DatePicker Doesn't Focus Correctly On iPad
node.body:
## I'm submitting a...
* Bug report

## Current behavior
'Tabbing' to the DatePicker on iPad Safari places the cursor at the end of the field.

## Expected behavior
It should place the cursor at the start (in this case the Day field) so typing the date flows logically.

## Minimal reproduction of the problem with instructions
Editor URL:
https://stackblitz.com/edit/react-fzcstv

Viewer URL:
https://react-fzcstv.stackblitz.io

1. Tap into the empty example textbox to focus it.
2. Press the 'next field' button on the keyboard (functions like pressing Tab) to navigate to the DatePicker.
3. The cursor will be placed at the end, and typing will type into Year. It is impossible from this point to type into Day or Month without carefully tapping the section on the screen.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12272970/52030319-2e4a6f00-2567-11e9-86dc-3fa7d77985c0.png)

## What is the motivation or use case for changing the behavior?
We have a DatePicker as part of a form. When tabbing to focus the DatePicker, users started typing the Day field without noticing it focused incorrectly, causing extra clicks and frustration.

Browser:
- Safari (iOS) version 12.1.1

Bug Report

Current behavior
* We have a grid with virtualization and without rowHeight
* Alternatively: We have a grid with virtualization and rowHeight and grouping
* In both cases we do not know the full height of all rows, so we have some blank space at the end of the grid
* I scroll to the bottom of the grid, to last item, I release keyboard or mouse
* issue 1 - Always - I try to scroll further down, the last item flickers
* issue 2 - Sometimes, randomly - I try to scroll further down with keyboard or mouse, the last item disappears and I have no items on page

node.body:
<!--
  Please help us process GitHub issues faster by providing the necessary information in the template format that follows.

## Current behavior
When TreeView data is more than what fits in the TreeView render area and a vertical scrollbar appears, before clicking/focusing on the TreeView, if we scroll down the tree and then focus/click, the scroll position is lost and the TreeView component scrolls to the top, selecting/focusing the first element. Even if a data item has selected:true, this still happens on the first focus. Note. it happens only on the first focus.

On focus, initial or subsequent, the scroll position should not get affected and the item clicked, should get focused/selected, not the first item in the data list.

https://twj8am.run.stackblitz.io

https://www.telerik.com/kendo-react-ui/components/treeview/
then, resize the browser window height to be small enough so that a vertical scrollbar appears.
scroll down to the last treeView item and then click it.

## What is the motivation or use case for changing the behavior?
any scenario where there are more data items than can fit into the view, cause this on initial click/focus... it requires the user to click twice just to select one item.

latest chrome browser

node.title: Accessibility improvements
node.body:
This ticket is a summary list of known KendoReact Accessibility Issues. Tracked in one place for simplicity and share-ability with other Kendo teams. Feel free to create a separate ticket if needed. I will mark from red to green the "done" items

:red_circle: We should add an Accessibility theme to the Kendo UI Themes suit. Synced with Ivan Zhekov, this item is here just for completeness and FYI
- contrast
- prominent focus
- always specify a background color

:red_circle: Our components should support an optional property that adds a tabindex attribute to the following HTML elements -All Anchor, AREA, BUTTON, INPUT, OBJECT, SELECT, and TEXTAREA. This is not done for the following components
- Conversational ui
- Dialog
- Grid
- Menu
- PanelBar
- Splitter


:red_circle: Our components should support an optional property that adds Accesskey attribute (aka keyboard shortcut) to the following HTML elements - A, AREA, BUTTON, INPUT, LABEL, LEGEND, and TEXTAREA.
- Almost all components
- [Spec Link](https://www.w3.org/TR/WCAG10-HTML-TECHS/#link-accesskey)

:red_circle: SVG elements should use title or desc or valid ARIA attributes for providing a description. Either aria-labelledby, aria-describedby or aria-label must have a value. Noticed in:
-  Charts
- Gauges
- "enter" element in conversational-ui
- [Spec Link](https://www.access-board.gov/guidelines-and-standards/communications-and-it/about-the-section-508-standards/guide-to-the-section-508-standards/web-based-intranet-and-internet-information-and-applications-1194-22)

:red_circle: IMG elements are required to have a size specified if they have an intrinsic size. The following components are reported to miss height attribute:
- Avatars in Conversational IU
- Buttons with IMG
- Tabstrip with images
- [Spec Link](https://www.w3.org/TR/mobile-accessibility-mapping/)

:red_circle: All IMG elements are required to contain either the ALT or LONGDESC attribute
- Avatar IMGs in Conversational UI
- Tabstrip with images

:red_circle: INPUT element does not use an ALT attribute, TITLE attribute or linked LABEL.
- Conversational UI
- Dropdowns
- Grid Filter subcomponent
- [Spec Link 1](https://www.w3.org/TR/WCAG20-TECHS/H65.html)
- [Spec Link 2](https://www.w3.org/TR/WCAG10-HTML-TECHS/#forms-graphical-buttons)

:red_circle: SELECT element needs label (preferred) or title.
- Dropdowns (ex: e2e/label.html , dropdownlist/select-cases.html)
- Grid - pagination and filter subcomponents
- [Spec Link](https://www.w3.org/TR/WCAG10-HTML-TECHS/#forms-labels)

:red_circle: LINKS / ANCHORS are required to have descriptive texts.
- 4 anchors/links in grid pagination subcomponent
- Advert pics in Conversational UI
- [Spec Link 1](https://www.w3.org/TR/WCAG20-TECHS/H30.html)
- [Spec Link 2](https://www.w3.org/TR/WCAG20-TECHS/H83.html)

:red_circle: All LINKS / ANCHORS not surrounding images are required to not be directly adjacent
- 4 anchors/links in grid pagination subcomponent
- [Spec Link](https://www.w3.org/TR/WCAG10-HTML-TECHS/#group-bypass)
- [Suggestion - maybe group in nav element?](https://www.w3.org/TR/WCAG20-TECHS/H97.html)

:red_circle: LINKS / ANCHORS require ALT attribute
- Close button in a dialog

:red_circle: Data table element must have a caption element
- Calendar
- Multiview Calendar
- Grid
- [Spec Link](https://www.w3.org/TR/WCAG20-TECHS/H39.html)

:red_circle: Use id and headers attribute to associate data cells with header cells in data tables	Complex data table doesn't have headers attributes to TD and TH elements.
- Calendar
- Multiview Calendar
- Grid
- [Spec Link](https://www.w3.org/TR/WCAG20-TECHS/H43)

:red_circle: Use the scope attribute to associate header cells and data cells in data tables	TH elements must specify scope attribute
- Calendar
- Multiview Calendar
- Grid
- [Spec Link](https://www.w3.org/TR/WCAG20-TECHS/H63)

:red_circle: For data tables that have two or more logical levels of row or column headers, use markup to associate data cells and header cells	Table uses markup to associate data and header cells but has no summary.
- Calendar
- Multiview Calendar
- Grid
- [Spec Link](https://www.w3.org/TR/WCAG10-HTML-TECHS/#identifying-table-rows-columns)

:red_circle: For data tables that have two or more logical levels of row or column headers, use markup to associate data cells and header cells.	The table uses markup to associate data and header cells but has no valid ARIA attribute. 
- Calendar
- Multiview Calendar
- Grid
- [Spec Link](https://www.access-board.gov/guidelines-and-standards/communications-and-it/about-the-section-508-standards/guide-to-the-section-508-standards/web-based-intranet-and-internet-information-and-applications-1194-22)

:red_circle: Multiselect renders a list of selected items. We would like to not render the list when it's empty.

:red_circle: As advised by Compliance Sheriff, we ran the rendered HTML of most of our examples against [a W3C Validator](https://validator.w3.org/) and the output contained multiple errors. 
- [Spec Link](https://www.w3.org/TR/WCAG20-TECHS/G134.html)

:red_circle: It is expected that without CSS our components are not pretty, but they should have basic functionality. Here is a list of issues when we run examples without CSS
- Zoom and push animations, popups, tooltips - all play at wrong locations
- Buttons - usable, but not clear if pressed or not
- All rtl demos have issues
- Dropdownlist, Window, Charts, Calendar, Multiview Calendar, Timepicker, Gauges, Switches - broken, not usable
- Dateinput, Datepicker, Daterangepicker, Menu, Panelbar, Splitter, Tabstrip - somewhat usable but buggy
- All dateinputs - gulp often blows with OOM for examples without CSS
- Dialog takes the whole page but works
- Grid - usable but layout is broken
- Input and NumericTextBox work fine just like basic inputs
- Ripple without CSS breaks UI
- The rest are usable enough
- [Spec Link](https://www.w3.org/TR/WCAG10-CSS-TECHS/#style-transform-gracefully)
